availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Isaac B. Askew (Trigg County, Kentucky, resident.)

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, resident. Ohio native. Son of Parker Askew and Hannah Askew. Married to Fanny Jenkins Askew in Trigg County, Kentucky, in January 1859. Father of Franklin Askew.

ab.bibl:
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, Cadiz, p. 48A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Trigg County Marriages, Film 000321335.
"Prominent Citizen Dies Suddenly at Cadiz," The Courier-Journal (Louisville, KY), July 1, 1906, p. 8.
David Sumner, Kim Fortner, Pam Metts, and Charles Morris, Cemeteries of Cadiz and Trigg County, Kentucky (Sunforme Publishing, 2008), p. 103.
William Wade Hinshaw, Encyclopedia of American Quaker Genealogy, ed. Thomas Worth Marshall, vol. 4, (Baltimore: Genealogical Publishing Co, Inc., 1946), p. 346.
